intro: Diplaspis morenonis, commonly known as the African shieldbug, is a species of plant bug native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Pentatomidae and is characterized by its distinct shield-shaped body and elongated legs. The plant serves as a host for various species of insects, including aphids and scale insects, making it ecologically significant in its native habitat. Diplaspis morenonis typically inhabits shrubs and trees, where it feeds on plant sap. Its presence is often an indicator of healthy, undisturbed ecosystems in its range.
